newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Fischler presents tobacco report to farm ministers.
newsitem.headline: Fischler presents tobacco report to farm ministers.

text.p: Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler presented a tobacco report to farm ministers on Monday urging that EU subsidies be aimed at improving quality and encouraging farmers to stop production, EU diplomats said.
The report also called for stricter controls and a simplification of the subsidy system.

They said that Greece and Italy afterwards stressed that the EU's tobacco regime should be kept as it provided important socio-economic aid for their farmers who lived in regions where there were no viable alternative crops.
But Britain called for a gradual phasing out of the regime, saying that socio-economic aid should be separated from agricultural assistance.
The report (COM 96/554) was adopted by the Commission on December 18 despite strong criticism that the subsidies hampered efforts to curb smoking related deaths.
